result.execSummary:
The defendant DWIGHT D PERRY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM OR CHILDREN UNDER 18 YEARS WITHOUT APPROVAL OF AGENT.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Zero credit.  NO GOOD TIME. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  
Defendant in custody at WCJ.

Defendant shall submit DNA Sample prior to release from the Winnebago Co Jail

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in court with attorney Daniel Mark Muza.  Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in custody at WCJ.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DWIGHT D PERRY appeared by video means with Attorney. Victim rights complied with. Defendant waives in person appearance. Oral recommendations. PSI waived.

11:12 AM Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in court with attorney Daniel Mark Muza.  Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in custody.  Anthony Prekop appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 11:16.  Arraignment scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 09:38 AM Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DWIGHT D PERRY appeared by video means.  The Public Defender is still looking for an attorney to take this case.  The DE wants an attorney for his Prelim, so the court will remove the Prelim and set another FP date.   The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Bond Continues.  Record closed @ 9:41.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:45 am.

CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1, C.S. & M.S. in Oshkosh PD report #22-13977.   No contact with the 0-100 block of E. Custer Ave. Oshkosh.  Absolute sobriety.  No alcohol consumption or possession.  Comply with the Alcohol 24/7 Program. Defendant shall contact (920)232-1919 IMMEDIATELY after their court hearing to schedule an appointment to be set up on the program.  If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.  The defendant shall bring the Alcohol Monitoring Device to every hearing.  Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are.

03:24 PM Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in court with attorney Emma K Blankschein.  Defendant DWIGHT D PERRY in custody.  Margaret Jeanne Struve appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DWIGHT D PERRY appeared by video means with Attorney.  Given/has complaint. Advised of charges & potential penalties.  The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings.  Victim's Father addresses the Court.  Record closed @ 3:33.  Further proceedings scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 11:45 am.
